intro: Pithecellobium gentlei, commonly known as the Hawaiian pili, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and lowland areas. It has small, edible pods that contain seeds, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for various wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
